text: we now know that it is an addiction we
know that romantic love is an addiction
a perfectly wonderful addiction when
it's going well in a perfectly horrible
addiction when it's going poorly when
it's going poorly you have to treat it
as an addiction throw out the cards and
letters or put them in the box and put
them in the Attic don't write don't call
don't show up where this person is
likely to be go out with old friends get
hugs from old friends that drives up the
oxytocin system and calms you down get
some physical exercise that drives up
the dopamine system that gives you
energy and optimism and focus and
motivation it also drives up are they
endorphins so that some of the pain goes
away we also know now that when you are
been rejected in love any kind of Advil
or aspirin actually helps take away some
of the physical pain and the last thing
that we've discovered is that the
farther you get away from that moment of
being dumped the less activity there is
in a brain system linked with feelings
of deep attachment so time does heal
just don't throw anything stupid and the
day will come when that person who's
been camping in your head his out and
you wake up in the morning and you
realize that yesterday you never thought
about the middle you know the opposite
of love is not hate the opposite of love
is indifference and that's what you're
shooting for when you've been dumped
